trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage issues with speech-recognition accuracy caused by audio-input quality.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage issues with speech-recognition accuracy caused by audio-input quality.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage issues with speech-recognition accuracy caused by audio-input quality.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage issues with speech-recognition accuracy caused by audio-input quality.

trans-unit.source: When speech recognition is active, use the [**RecognitionQualityDegrading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653243) event of your speech recognizer to determine whether one or more audio issues might be interfering with speech input.
trans-unit.target: When speech recognition is active, use the [**RecognitionQualityDegrading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653243) event of your speech recognizer to determine whether one or more audio issues might be interfering with speech input.

trans-unit.source: The event argument ([**SpeechRecognitionQualityDegradingEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631430)) provides the [**Problem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631431) property, which describes the issues detected with the audio input.
trans-unit.target: The event argument ([**SpeechRecognitionQualityDegradingEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631430)) provides the [**Problem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631431) property, which describes the issues detected with the audio input.

trans-unit.source: Recognition can be affected by too much background noise, a muted microphone, and the volume or speed of the speaker.
trans-unit.target: Recognition can be affected by too much background noise, a muted microphone, and the volume or speed of the speaker.

trans-unit.source: Here, we configure a speech recognizer and start listening for the [**RecognitionQualityDegrading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653243) event.
trans-unit.target: Here, we configure a speech recognizer and start listening for the [**RecognitionQualityDegrading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653243) event.

trans-unit.source: Use the description provided by the [**Problem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631431) property to help the user improve conditions for recognition.
trans-unit.target: Use the description provided by the [**Problem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631431) property to help the user improve conditions for recognition.

trans-unit.source: Here, we create a handler for the [**RecognitionQualityDegrading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653243) event that checks for a low volume level.
trans-unit.target: Here, we create a handler for the [**RecognitionQualityDegrading**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653243) event that checks for a low volume level.

trans-unit.source: We then use a [**SpeechSynthesizer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298152) object to suggest that the user try speaking louder.
trans-unit.target: We then use a [**SpeechSynthesizer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298152) object to suggest that the user try speaking louder.

trans-unit.source: Speech recognition and speech synthesis sample
trans-unit.target: Speech recognition and speech synthesis sample
